It was released in 1999 through [[Spinefarm Records]] in Europe and through [[Century Media Records|Century Media]] in the [[United States]]. It's the only album featuring bassist [[Janne Kivilahti]]. Regarding the track "Blank File", which covers the topic of [[Internet privacy|privacy on the Internet]], vocalist Tony Kakko once stated:<ref>{{cite web|last=Gehlke|first=David E.|title=Sonata Arctica – Replacing the Blank File|url=http://www.blistering.com/fastpage/fpengine.php/templateid/26934/menuid/3/tempidx/5/catid/4/restemp/N%3B/fPpagesel/2|accessdate=21 August 2012}}</ref> {{cquote|''I had a vision of how things would be in the future [laughs]. Now that we're in the future, it's not as horrendously bad, although people are being really bad about their privacy. If you upload your family pictures online somewhere, even if you think you've erased them from the server, they're still there. "Blank File" is all about that. [...] I didn't consider computers'' per se ''at the time. [...] The starting point was all of the phone cards we had at the time, and when you're shopping on the concord, someone knew what you bought. I found that somehow, disturbing. It's great to realize that after so long, your songs are still valid.''}} ==Track listing== All songs written by Tony Kakko except where noted. # "Blank File" – 4:05 # "My Land" – 4:36 # "8th Commandment" (Kakko, Liimatainen) – 3:41 # "Replica" (Kakko, Liimatainen) – 4:55 # "Kingdom for a Heart" – 3:51 # "Fullmoon" – 5:06 # "Letter to Dana" – 6:00 # "Unopened" – 3:42 # "Picturing the Past" (Kakko, Liimatainen) – 3:36 # "Destruction Preventer" – 7:40 # "Mary-Lou" – 4:30 (Bonus track on [[Korea]]n, [[Japan]]ese, [[South America]]n and other releases) # "Letter to Dana (Returned to Sender)" - 4:39 (Available on 2008 Re-issue)<ref>[http://www.sonataarctica.info/site07/gallery.php?id=226&s=29&l=uk]</ref> ==Personnel== *[[Tony Kakko]] – vocals, keyboards *[[Jani Liimatainen]] – guitars *[[Janne Kivilahti]] – bass guitar *[[Tommy Portimo]] – drums *[[Raisa Aine]] – flute on "Letter to Dana" ==Info== *Mixed by Mikko Karmila at [[Finnvox Studios]] and mastered by Mika Jussila at Finnvox Studios. *Re-released in October 2008 in Japan, Finland and the UK by [[Spinefarm]].
